ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000HYMql:ref

Hi Ilya,

I am sorry as we cannot do this. “Disable and see” No, we are talking about production environment, and this is not allowed at all. I remember TLS is enabled and Ciphers also configured on the server.

Please be sure whether to disable or keep the settings as it is.

Thanks and Regards,

Praveen V Huilgol
IBM Security.

Praveen,

Our applications do not require TLS 1.0, as it is very outdated. Disable it and see if the application functions properly. If it doesn't it would be obvious quite fast, and would mean that your settings were modified to use that for some reason.

Best wishes,
Ilya Kotov
Technical Support Engineer

ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0HYMql:ref



[https://nwxcorp.my.salesforce.com/servlet/servlet.ImageServer?oid=00D7000000091pB&esid=018Qk00000Fs7Yf&from=ext]
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #425193 -  - TLS Vulenrability    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0HYMql:ref ]

TextBody:
Hello Praveen,

In order to best advise your course of action we must fully understand why you enabled TLS1.0 during your deployment.

Netwrix Enterprise Auditor has no specific requirement for TLS 1.0 and relies on the operating system to assign proper standards.

If I were to hazard a guess, I think you needed TLS 1.0 in 2020 because you were still using Internet Explorer to load the AIC on the host.  If the conditions that required you to enable TLS 1.0 no longer exist in your environment you can safely disable TLS 1.0. This is dependent on your environment - it is not determined by any requirement of Enterprise Auditor.

Thank you,

Brandon West
Technical Support Manager
Phone: 1-949-407-5125 | Toll-free: 888-638-9749
____________________ __________
Powerful Data Security Made Easy

6160 warren Parkway, Suite 100, Frisco, TX 75034
www.netwrix.com

TextBody:
Praveen,

The only reason to use TLS 1.0 would be the continued (and not secure) usage of the deprecated Internet Explorer. There's, currently, to reiterate:

>Netwrix Enterprise Auditor has no specific requirement for TLS 1.0 and relies on the operating system to assign proper standards.

Best wishes,

--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: Netwrix Support [techsupport@netwrix.com]
Sent: 11/6/2024 6:41 PM
To: prhuilgo@in.ibm.com
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #425193 - - TLS Vulenrability [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0HYMql:ref ]

Hello Praveen,

In order to best advise your course of action we must fully understand why you enabled TLS1.0 during your deployment.

Netwrix Enterprise Auditor has no specific requirement for TLS 1.0 and relies on the operating system to assign proper standards.

If I were to hazard a guess, I think you needed TLS 1.0 in 2020 because you were still using Internet Explorer to load the AIC on the host.  If the conditions that required you to enable TLS 1.0 no longer exist in your environment you can safely disable TLS 1.0. This is dependent on your environment - it is not determined by any requirement of Enterprise Auditor.

Thank you,

Brandon West
Technical Support Manager
Phone: 1-949-407-5125 | Toll-free: 888-638-9749

6160 warren Parkway, Suite 100, Frisco, TX 75034
